newsitem.title: USA: Southdown sees Q3 EPS beating estimates.
newsitem.headline: Southdown sees Q3 EPS beating estimates.

text.p: Southdown Inc said on Monday it expects fully diluted earnings for the third quarter to be higher than analysts' estimates, due to increases in cement sales volumes and in average cement sales prices.

The company said it expected its earnings for the quarter ending September 30 would be about $1.10 to $1.15 per share, above both consensus estimates of $0.90 per share and the $0.70 per share earned in the third quarter of 1995.
Based on future growth prospects, Southdown said it intended to add about 10 percent to its manufacturing capacity over the next few years.
Cement sales volumes rose about 12 percent over the prior year and average cement sales prices increased by $1.44 per short ton, Southdown said.
Southdown manufactures cement and ready-mixed concrete in eight plants across the United States.

Clarence Comer, president and chief executive officer, said: "The company continues to achieve record earnings based on strong demand in all of its market areas. Based on the outlook for continuing growth, the company intends to add approximately 10 percent to its manufacturing capacity over the next few years through selective expansion projects at a number of its plants."
